(England and Wales. Court of Requests)

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the deputies of C. Barker],

notesStmt.note: The text proper begins with new register on p. 1; caption title: "In nomine Domini nostri Iesu Christi. 13. Februarij. 1592. Actes, orders, and decrees made by the King and his Counsell, 9. H.7. ..". This section is sometimes found separately from the preliminaries.
The last leaf is blank. An errata leaf is inserted preceding this, possibly only in later copies.
Reproductions of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 193 (main text only) and at reel 198 (same copy filmed twice).

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: THE ANCIENT STATE, AVTHORITIE, AND PROCEEDINGS OF THE COVRT OF REQVESTS.
Anno 1597.

div.head: THE ANCIENT ſtate, authoritie, and proceedings of the Court of Requeſts.

p.hi: THE Court of Requeſts now ſo called, was, and is parcell of the Kings most honourable Councell, and ſo alwayes called, and eſteemed.

div.p: Penultimo Aprilis. & 1. Iulij. 17. H. 7. 27. Maij 21. H. 7. & 18. Septemb. 6. H. 8. 28. Nouemb. 12. H. 8. 18. Iulij 14. H. 8. vltimo Nouembris. 27. H. 8. 6. Nouembris. 30. H. 8. 21. Aprilis 31. H. 8. 3. Iulij 32. H. 8. 8. Iulij eodem. 14. Martij. 33. H. 8. 15. Nouemb. 35. H. 8. 11. Nouembris. 36. H. 8. 1. Febr. 37. H. 8. 1. Iunij. 38. H. 8. 29. Iulij. eodem. 25. Septemb. eod. & 5. Iulij. 6. Edw. 6. 1. Febr. 7. Edw. 6. 8. Maij. eod. & 7. Maij. 1. Mariae. 25. Octobris. 1. & 2. P. & M. 21. Nouemb. eodem. 28. Nouemb. 2. & 3. P. & M. 12. Iunij. eod. 19. Iunij. 3. & 4. P. & M. & 29. Iunij. eod. & 12. Febr. 9. H. 7.

p.hi: THe Iudges of that Court were alwaies of the kings most honorable Councell appointed by the King to keepe his Councell bourd.

div.p: 12. Feb. 9. H. 7. 21. Martij. 12. H. 7. 28. Maij. 13. H. 7. 29. Iun. 14. H. 7. 11. Martij. 15. H. 7. 9. Martij. 17. H. 7. 22. Nouemb. 21. H. 7. & 28. Ianuar. 20. H. 8. 10. Iulij. 24. H. 8. & 23. Maij 25. H. 8. 24. Nouembris. 26. H. 8. 23. Ianu. 29. H. 8. 28. Iunij. 33. H. 8. 6. Nouemb. eod. 10. Feb. eod. & 27. Nouemb. 1. Edw. 6. 29. Ian. 6. E. 6. 12. Iunij. 7. E. 6. & 19. Nouemb. 1. Mariae. 26. Ian eod. 1. Iunij. eod. 20. Ian. 1. & 2. P. & M. 6. Maij. eodem. 24. Nouembris. 2. & 3. P. & M. 25. Nouembris. 3. & 4. P. & M. 3 Nouemb. 4. & 5. P. & M.

THe keeping of this Court was neuer heretofore tied to any place certeine; but onely where the Councell ſate, the ſuitors were to attend: But now of late for the eaſe of ſuitors, it hath bene kept in the White-hall in Weſtminſter, and onely in the Terme time. viz.

At Sheene. 3. Martij. 9. H. 7. At Canterb. 12. April. eod. At Windſor. 20. Iulij. eod. At Langley. 6. Sept. 10. H. 7. At Woodſt. 7. Octob. eod. At Worceſter. 9. Iulij. eod. At Nottingham. 24. Auguſti. 11. H. 7. At Leiceſter. 29. Auguſti. eodem. &c.

p.hi: THe Court of Requeſtes a Court of Record.

div.p: 5. Iulij. 3. & 4. Philippi & Mariae.

p.hi: REcognizaunces taken by the Kings Councell (in his Court of Requeſtes) at Weſtminſter.

div.p: 13. Iunij. & 18. Iunij. 13. H. 8. 15. Octob. eod. 26. April 21. H. 8. 11. Iunij. eod. 8. Iulij. 25. H. 8.

p.hi: TEmporall: As matters of title, and poſſeſsion of lands.

div.p: 17. Febr. 11. H. 7. 15. Febr. 12. H. 7. 17. Feb. eodem. vlt. Nouemb. 14. H. 7. 2 Maij. eodem. & 9. Maij. eod. & 17 Auguſti. eod. & 19. Nouemb. 18. H. 7. 15. Nouembris. 19. H. 7. & 16. Decemb. 2. H. 8. 15. Maij. 7. H. 8. 1. Iulij. 8. H. 8. 27. Maij. 9. H. 8. 9. Nouemb. 15. H. 8. 6. Iulij. 31. H. 8.

p.hi: Matters of title onely.
Matters of poſſeſsion onely.

div.p: 18. Octobris. 11. H. 8. 5. Feb. eod. 15. Febr. 12. H. 8. 8. Nouemb. 13. H. 8. 25. Maij. 28. H. 8. 25. Octob. 31. H. 8. 22. Decemb. 37. H. 8. & 20 April. 2. E. 6. 18. Maij. 4. E. 6. vlt. Maij. 2. Elizabethae.

p.hi: Matters of Annuities, extents, debt with ſpecialties, and without, deteining of euidences, rent, aſſurance of lands, &c.

div.p: 24. Octobr. 13. H. 8. 18. Maij. 22. H. 8. 30. Nouemb. 27. H. 8. 29. Maij. 33. H. 8. 6. Maij. 34. H. 8. 30. Aprilis. 37. H. 8. & 8. Iulij. 3. Edw. 6. 30. Maij. 6. Ed. 6. 8. Feb. 7. Ed. 6. 13. Maij. 2. Elizabethae.

p.hi: Matters of contracts, villainage, water courſes, & couenants, and high wayes.

div.p: 10. Febr. 8. H. 8. 24. Nouemb. 10. H. 8. 13. Febr. 11. H. 8. 6. Nouemb. 26. H. 8. 25. Iunij. 36. H. 8. 25. Nouembris. eod. 27. Nouemb. 37. H. 8. 6. Iunij. 38. H. 8. & vlt. Ianuar. 2. Ed. 6. 11. Feb. 4. E. 6.

p.hi: Matters of Dower, Ioynture, and Contracts for marriages.

div.p: 15. Martij. 11. H. 7. 14. Nouemb. 14. H. 7. 24. Feb. eod. 16. Feb. 24. H. 8.

p.hi: Matters of wilfull eſcape.
Forfeitures to the King by Recognizance, or otherwiſe.

div.p: 9. Nouemb. 11. H. 7. 5. Martij. 13. H. 7. 26. Febr. 19. H. 7. 14. Octobr. 22. H. 7. & 4. Iulij. 38. H. 8. & 4. Febr. 2. Ed. 6. & 12. Maij. eodem.

p.hi: Riots, and Routs, Forgerie, and Periurie.
Cauſes tried heere, whereas the Defendant dwelt in the Marches of Wales, or in the North.
Sometimes cauſes referred to the Iudges of the law, and their aduiſe required.
THe forme of the proceeding in this Court, was altogether according to the proceſſe of ſummary cauſes in the Ciuill Law.

div.p: 5. Feb. 13. H. 7. 14. Nouemb. 14. H. 7. 3 Decemb eodem. 20. Martij. eodem. 18. Martij. 15. H 7. & 17 Decembris. 10. H. 8. & 18. Nouemb. 22. H. 8. 18. Nouemb. 31. H 8. & 21. Maij. 3. & 4. P. & M. & 5. Iunij. 1. Elizabethae.

p.hi: THe perſons plaintifs, and Defendants, betweene whom they iudged, were alwayes either priuiledged as officers of the Court, or their ſeruants, or as the Kings ſeruants, or neceſſarie attendants on them; or els where the Plaintifs pouertie, or mean estate was not matchable with the wealth, or greatnes of the Defendant: or where the cauſe meerely conteined matter of equity, and had no proper remedy at the Common law: or where the cauſe was ſpecially recommended from the King, to the examination of his Councell: or cauſes concerning Vniuerſities Colledges, Schooles, Hoſpitalles, and the like. As

div.p: 18. Nouembris. 11. H. 7. 27. Nouemb. eod. 11. Decemb. eod. 26. Nouembris. 14. H. 7. 1. Maij. eodem. 6. Iulij. 17. H. 7. 13. Martij. 1 • . H. 7. vltim. Iulij. eod. 28. Maij 21. H. 7. 14. Feb. 23. H. 7. & 27. Octob. 3. H. 8. 13. Iulij. 11. H. 8. 4. Febr. 12. H. 8. 21. Feb. eodem. 6. Iunij. 13. H. 8. 18. Octobris 22. H. 8. 4. Iulij. 24. H. 8. 17 Nouemb. 25. H. 8. 6. Iunij. 29. H. 8. 2. & 4. Nouemb. 30. H. 8. 6. Febr. 31. H. 8. 8. Iunij. 32. H. 8. 12. Febr. eodem. 17. Octob. 38. H. 8. 20. Nouemb. eod. 26. Nouemb. eod. & 4. Feb. 1. E. 6. & 6. Feb. eod 22. Ma • j eod. 28 Iun. eod. 5. Iulij. eod. 18. Octob. eod. 30. Ianuar 2. Ed. 6. 9. Feb. eod. 9. Iun. eod. 26. Nouemb. 4 E. 6. & 24. Ianuarij, & 24. Aprilis. 5. Edw. 6.26. Maij. 6. Ed 6. 26. Aprilis. 1. M. 28. Maij. eod. 25. Octob. 3. & 4. P. & M. 5. Maij eod. 10 Feb 4 & 5 P. & M. 9. Maij. eod. 24. Iunij eod.

p.hi: THE cauſes wherewith they deale, and whereof they iudge, are of all ſorts: As Maritime, Eccleſiaſticall, Temporall, but properly of Temporall cauſes, and onely of the other ſort, as they are mixt with Temporall.

div.p: Eccleſiaſticall. 2. Martij. 17. H. 7. 15. Iulij. 20. H. 7. & 25. Nouemb. 8. H. 8. 12. Febr. 21. H. 8. 25. Maij. 33. H. 8. 25. Nouemb. 34. H. 8. 20. Nouembris, & 21. Feb. 35. H. 8. & 22. Iunij. 2. Edw. 6. 28. Nouemb. eod. 20. Maij. 3. Ed. 6. 28. Nouemb. eod. 23. Nouemb. 5. Ed. 6. 22. Iunij. 7. E. 6. & 7. Maij. 1 M. 18. Nouemb. 4 & 5. P. & M.
Maritime. 3. Martij. 9. H. 7. 24. Martij. 10. H. 7. 21. Aprilis. eodem. 25. Aprilis. eodem. & penult. Martij. 11. H. 7.
Vltramarine. 21. Maij. 15. H. 7. 13. Iulij. 17. H. 7. & 16. Feb. 10. H. 8. & 27. Feb. eodem. & 4. Nouemb. 6. Ed 6. & 25. Octobris. 3. & 4. P. & M.
TEmporall: As temporall offices, &c. 25. Feb. 14. H. 7. & 22. Octob. 31. H. 8. 4. Iulij. 38. H. 8. & 4. Iunij. 3. Edw. 6. vltimo Aprilis. 5. Edw. 6. 19. Feb. 7. E. 6.

list.head: THe maner of proceeding in the ſayd Court.
list.item: 1. Firſt by Priuy ſeale, Letter miſsiue, or Iniunction, or meſſenger, or bond.

div.p: 11. Nouemb. 11. H. 7. 14. Decemb. eod. 10. Feb. 12. H. 7. 21. Feb. eod. 14. April. eod. 4. Feb. 17. H. 7. & 30. Maij. 14. H. 8. & 6. April. 7. E. 6.

p.hi: APparances by vertue of the Priuie ſeale.

div.p: 6. Iulij. 15. H. 7. 5. Iulij. 16. H. 7. 16. Nouemb. 18. H. 7. 15. Iulij. 19. H. 7. 21. Iunij. 20. H. 7. 29. Martij. 21. H. 7. 2. Iunij. eod. 15. Octob. 22. H. 7. 27. Ianua. eod. 21. April. eod. 23. Octob. 23. H. 7. 25. Nouemb. 23. H. 7. 19. Maij. eod. & 4. Nouēb. 3. H. 8. 6. Nouēb. eod. 20. Ian. eod. & 4. Martij. 6. H. 8. 20. Octob. 7. H. 8. 15. Iun. 9. H. 8. 16. Octob. 12. H. 8. 22. Aprilis. 14. H. 8. 4. Iulij. 24. H. 8. 23. Ianu. 25. H. 8. 22. Iunij. 33. H. 8.

p.hi: APparances by bond, or letter miſsiue in the Starre chamber, or elſwhere, or the Kings ſignet.

div.p: 15. Aug. 9. H. 7. 26. April. 12. H. 7. 6. Martij. 16. H. 7. 3. Nouemb. 21. H. 7. 27. Iunij. 21. H. 7. & penult. Octob. 2. H. 8. 8. Iul. 10. H. 8. 18. Nouemb. eod. 13. Octob. 11. H. 8. 17. Octob. eod. 12. Nouemb. 12. H. 8. 28. Ian. eod. & 10. Maij. 16. H. 8.

p.hi: APparances by Meſſenger, either Purſuiuant, or Sergeant at Armes.

div.p: 1. Iunij. 14. H. 7. 20. Maij. 18. H. 7. 7. Iunij. 19. H. 7. 12. Iunij. eod. & 1. Maij. 13. H. 8. 28. Iunij. 31. H. 8. & 28. April. 1. M. 18. Iunij. 2. & 3. P. & M.

p.hi: APparances being ſo enioined by Commiſsioners.

div.p: 3. Iunij 12. H. 7. 18. Octob. 18. H. 7. 24. Octobris. 23. H. 7. 18. Feb eod. & 16. Octob. 3. H. 8. 4. Nouēb. 7. H. 8. 11. Maij. 11. H. 8. 5. Iulij eod. 4. Nouemb. eod. 23. Ianuarij. 12. H. 8. 26. Octob. 14. H. 8. 5 Feb. eod. & 10. Octob. 34. H. 8. & 26. Ian. 1 Mar. 27. April. 1. M.

p.hi: POſſeſsion of landes giuen for contempt in not appearance, or not anſwering after appearance: as

div.p: 17. Feb. 12. H. 7. 16. Ianu. 4. E. 6. 8. Iunij. 2. & 3. P. & M. 27. Ianuarij. 4. & 5. P. & M. & 19. Octob. 1. Eliz. & 5. Febr. 2. Elizabethae. & 2. Maij. 10. Maij. & 16. Nouemb. eod.

THat the party Defendant attend De die, in diem on the Councell, till he haue made his aunſwere to the Plaintifs bill, and be licenced to depart vpon caution De Iudicio ſiſti, & Iudicato ſoluendo, and constitution of his Atturney and Counſell by name.

3. Mart. 12. H. 7. 23. Feb. 14. H. 7. 9. Maij. 14 H. 7. & 7. Decēb. 17. H. 7. 13. April. 29. Iunij. & 2. Iul. 17 H. 7. vlt. Octob. & 4. Nouemb. 18. H. 7.29. Nouēb. 21. H. 7. & 9. Maij. 4. H. 8. 20, & 22. Iunij. 9. H. 8. 9. Feb. 9. H. 8. 24 Iun. 10. H. 8. vlt Ian. eod. & 10. Maij. 11. H. 8. 28. Ian eod. H. 8. 21. Maij 14. H. 8. 2. Iulij. eod. 12. Iunij. 17. H. 8. 21. Iun. 22. H. 8. & 7. Nouemb 6▪ E 6. & 9. Feb. 3. & 4 P. & M.

p.hi: SOmetimes anſweres put into the Court by the Gardian of an Infant.

div.p: 24. Nouemb. 4. & 5. P. & M.

p.hi: SOmetimes anſweres taken by Commiſsion, vpon othe made, that the party for olde age or infirmity can not appeare: as

div.p: 13. Nouemb. 11. H. 7. & 19. Octobris. 1. H. 8. 29. Ianuarij. 11. H. 8. 25. Iunij. 14. H. 8. 26. Iunij. 30. H. 8. 23. Ianuarij. 34. H. 8. & 7. Nouembris. 5. & 6. P. & M. & 10. Octobris. 1. Elizabethae.

p.hi: SOmetimes anſweres of the Defendant reſpited, till the Plaintife haue payde charges giuen againſt him by a former Decree: as

div.p: 8. Nouemb. 2. & 3. P. & M.

p.hi: THat both parties, or the one of them be ſometimes commaunded to bring into the Court, all their Euidences, Writings, Miniments, Bondes, &c. concerning the cauſe.

div.p: 6. Septemb. 11. H. 7. 15. Decemb. eod. 12. Aprilis. 14. H. 7. 14. Febr. 17. H. 7. 30. Maij. eod. 10 Decembris. 18. H. 7. & 10. Feb. 29. H. 8.

p.hi: SOmetimes both the Plaintife & Defendant; ſometimes but one of them bound to the peace for himſelfe, & his men: as

INiunctions granted to bar the Defendant from ſuing the Plaintife at the Common law, and to ſtay the ſute at the Common law, before commenced, and not to arreſt the body of the Plaintife till further order be taken by the Kings Councell: as

div.p: 5. Maij. 12. H. 7. 7. Iulij. 16. H. 7. 27. Martij. & 21. Iunij. 18. H. 7. & 24. Maij. 19. H. 7. 6. & 7. Maij. 22. H. 7. 28. Octobris. & 18. Nouembris. 23. H. 7. & 10. Iunij. 8. H. 8. 4. Iulij. eod. 12. Maij. 13. H. 8. 18. Iulij. 14. H. 8. 8. Febr. 22. H. 8. 19. Nouemb. 24. H. 8. & 13. Febr. 2. Edw. 6. 28. Nouemb. 6. Edw. 6. & 17. Octob. 2. & 3. P. & M. 17. Nouemb. eod. 10. Feb. & 6. Maij. eod. & 27. Nouembris. 3. & 4. P. & M. 19. Maij. eod. 19. Nouembris. 4. & 5. P. & M. & 24. Nouemb. eodem. & 15. Febr. eodem.

p.hi: INiunctions not to fell wood, &c.

div.p: 7.23. & 27. Nouembr. 2. & 3. P. & M. & 5. Iunij. 1. Elizab.

p.hi: THat the execution of a Decree may be done either by impriſonment of the perſon diſobeying, being partie, or claiming vnder the party, or by leuie of the ſum adiudged vpon his lands: as

div.p: 4. April. 13. H. 7. 10. Iunij. 17. H. 7. & 12. Nouembr. 4. Ed. 6. 1. Aprilis. 7. Edw. 6. & 18. Iunij. 1. & 2. P. & M. & 16. Maij. 2. & 3. P. & M. & 27. April. 1. Eliz. 19. Maij. 3. Eliz. 18. Nouemb. 4. Eliz.

div.opener: IN NOMINE DOMINI noſtri IESV CHRISTI. 13. Februarij. 1592.
div.head: Actes, Orders, and Decrees made by the King and his Counſell, 9. H. 7. remaining amongst the Records of the Court, now commonly called the Court of Requeſts.
div.p: 12DIe Februarij anno H. 7. nono per Regiam Celſitudinem appuntuantur domini & alij Conſiliarij ſubſcripti ad obſeruandū Conſilium ſuum a die 12. praedicto, per totum iter per eundem dominum Regem poſt Paſcha faciendum, modo ſequenti.
Epiſcopus Bathon. poſt Paſcha continuè.
Epiſcopus Exon.
Epiſcopus Roffenſis continuè.

Dominus Prior S. Ioannis, poſt 15. dies poſt Paſcha continuè vſ
que ad menſem Auguſti proximum.
Dominus de Daubeney menſibus Auguſti, Septembris, & Octobris.
Dominus de Broke cum domino Priori eiſdem menſibus.
